TITLE: Why this could be the 'best time' to contribute to a retirement plan, according to an advisor
SUMMARY: Retirement 401(k) account balances are down significantly, which makes this a good time to add to your long-term savings, one expert says.

TITLE: Op-ed: Be sure to ask these 5 questions before hiring a new financial advisor
SUMMARY: There are more than a few factors to consider when deciding whether to work with a financial advisor. Here's a look at some key boxes to check before deciding.

TITLE: Medicare beneficiaries could pay less for 27 drugs covered under Part B starting next month
SUMMARY: Depending on their Medicare coverage, beneficiaries could save between $2 and $390 per average dose for these drugs starting April 1, officials announced.

TITLE: Here's how to report 2022 crypto losses on your tax return
SUMMARY: If you’re still recovering from last year’s crypto losses, it may be possible to score a tax break on your 2022 return. Here's what to know before filing.

TITLE: College hopefuls have a new ultimate dream school — and it's not Harvard, Princeton or Yale
SUMMARY: As National College Decision Day approaches, most of the colleges at the top of students' wish lists are among the most selective and most expensive.

TITLE: 84% of recent first-time home sellers have regrets. Here are 4 mistakes to avoid
SUMMARY: A recent survey found 9 in 10 recent first-time home sellers feel they could have sold their homes for more money. Here's where they think they went wrong.

TITLE: Retail egg prices fell in February — but the price drop may not last long
SUMMARY: The average retail price of eggs fell in February for the first time in months but may rise again as Easter approaches, experts said.

TITLE: Don't believe these 5 tax myths. Here's what you need to know before you file this year's return
SUMMARY: Know the facts when you're filing your taxes this season. Here's a look at the truth behind some common tax myths.

TITLE: Why you should buy everything with credit cards — provided you meet 1 condition
SUMMARY: Having multiple credit cards can save you hundreds of dollars each year. How much money you save depends on your lifestyle and how you play the rewards game.

TITLE: This individual retirement account option 'surprises people the most,' says advisor
SUMMARY: A spousal individual retirement account allows you to contribute based on your spouse's earnings if you file taxes jointly. Here's what couples need to know.

TITLE: Here's the inflation breakdown for February — in one chart
SUMMARY: The annual inflation rate continues to cool gradually, according to the February inflation report issued Tuesday. But it remains high by historical standards.

TITLE: Should you be worried about your money, your bank or the U.S. banking system? Experts weigh in
SUMMARY: After the Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank failures, experts answer what a bank run is, how FDIC insurance works and whether your deposits are still safe.

TITLE: Despite market volatility, advisor says he's 'bullish' on crypto education. Here's why
SUMMARY: Despite the volatility in the cryptocurrency market, Douglas Boneparth, member of CNBC's Financial Advisor Council, said he's "bullish" on crypto education.

TITLE: How to factor your health into your financial planning, according to a doctor-turned-advisor
SUMMARY: While health insurance premiums and related expenses are important when it comes to cash flow, your health itself is key to other financial considerations.

TITLE: Investing in 2023 is 'definitely going to be rocky,' advisor says. How to stay the course
SUMMARY: Silicon Valley Bank is the latest example of a surprise event that may spook the markets. Investors who hang on will be rewarded, one advisor says.

TITLE: After SVB and Signature failures, what small businesses should look for when choosing a bank
SUMMARY: Following the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank, small business owners may reconsider where to keep their money.

TITLE: There's a quicker, cheaper way to go to college, but fewer students are trying it
SUMMARY: In some cases, students can complete an associate's degree by the time they finish high school, a type of dual enrollment known as "early college."

TITLE: Are your bank deposits FDIC-insured? What to know in the wake of Silicon Valley Bank, Signature Bank closures
SUMMARY: Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank customers are expected to have full access to their money. If your bank failed, could you expect the same?

TITLE: What Signature Bank, Silicon Valley Bank failures mean for consumers and investors
SUMMARY: Here's how the failures of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank and moves by U.S. regulators may affect your wallet, according to financial advisors.

TITLE: Think your house is haunted and want out? Author Grady Hendrix has ideas on how to sell it
SUMMARY: In Grady Hendrix's new novel, "How to Sell a Haunted House," protagonist Louise runs into trouble trying to sell the house she grew up in. Are ghosts to blame?

TITLE: I just traveled to Argentina — and doubled my money with a 'black market' exchange rate
SUMMARY: Hyperinflation has fueled the creation of multiple exchange rates in Argentina, where cash is king. There's a legal way for tourists to get a preferential rate.

TITLE: Biden's budget pushes to renew bigger child tax credit payments for families
SUMMARY: President Biden wants larger child tax credits for parents as part of the pro family policies in his budget. But getting Congressional approval won't be easy.

TITLE: Wage growth is cooling — but workers still have bargaining power, economists say
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve is trying to rein in historically high wage growth to tame inflation. Overall, the job market remains hot for workers, economists said.

TITLE: Families get these 3 things wrong about estate planning, advisor says
SUMMARY: Many clients think estate planning is "only for rich people," among other misconceptions, said Lee Baker, a certified financial planner based in Atlanta.

TITLE: Employers can use this retirement perk as a ‘stepping stone’ to a 401(k), says advisor
SUMMARY: A SIMPLE IRA is generally easier and less costly than a 401(k) plan, according to the IRS, and may help employers compete in today's hot labor market.

TITLE: 31% of new cars sold for above sticker price last month. These 10 models have the biggest premiums
SUMMARY: Even though new car buyers are paying less of a premium than a year ago, the average sale is 8.8% above the manufacturer's suggested retail price, or MSRP.

TITLE: Biden budget calls for 'protecting and strengthening' Social Security
SUMMARY: While Biden's 2024 budget is light on details for long-term Social Security fixes, it does include increased funding aimed at reducing long waits for services.

TITLE: President Biden’s proposed 2024 budget calls for top 39.6% tax rate
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden is proposing higher taxes on wealthy Americans to help cover priorities like Medicare and Social Security in his 2024 budget.

TITLE: Career expert Suzy Welch: Use these tips to recession-proof your job and avoid getting laid off
SUMMARY: With a looming recession more layoffs are imminent, if not expected. Career expert Suzy Welch has tips for employees who want to make sure they're not next.

TITLE: Here's how much you need to save every month to earn $70,000 per year in interest for retirement
SUMMARY: Saving enough money now could make it possible for you to fund your retirement by living off of your returns without ever touching your nest egg.
